intro: Critesion pusillum subsp. euclaston, commonly known as the narrowleaf critea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sandy or gravelly soils in grassland habitats. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight bluish-gray hue. It is a perennial species that blooms from late summer to early autumn.
